result.execSummary:
The defendant Pierrish R Moore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (>1-5g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1r.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (>1-5g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1r.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court orders defendant entitled to Substance Abuse Program if he has not already been thru the program.

superMiscConds.notes:
-AODA with counseling/treatment deemed appropriate.
-Absolute sobriety.
-No controlled substances or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription.
-Submit DNA sample.
-Maintain employmetn of at least 30 hours per week or attend school.
-Pay supervision fees.

Sentencing hearing at 11-19-2015 03:15 pm

Defendant Pierrish R Moore in court with attorney Benjamin T Van Severen.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters guilty plea to Ct. 1 & 2. Court examines defendant and finds him guilty. At time of sentencing, State recommends Ct. 1-7 years prison with 3 yrs initial confinement and 4 years extended supervision, Ct. 2-5 years probation consecutive. Restitution of $925.00. Court orders a presentence investigation, defendant may continue release on bail. Court orders defendant submit DNA sample. On motion of the State, Ct. 3 & 4 dismissed and readin for purposes of restitution.
